body_html:
That doesn't work for newgate.

On Mon, Oct 17, 2016 at 4:15 PM, Adam Paszke notifications@github.com
wrote:

@apaszke commented on this pull request.

In torch/nn/functions/rnn.py #129
:

  •    forgetgate = sigmoid(gates[:,1_hsz:2_hsz])

  •    cellgate   = tanh(   gates[:,2_hsz:3_hsz])

  •    outgate    = sigmoid(gates[:,3_hsz:4_hsz])

  •    cy = (forgetgate \* cx) + (ingate \* cellgate)

  •    hy = outgate \* tanh(cy)

  •    return hy, cy
    +def GRUCell(input, hidden, w_ih, w_hh, b_ih=None, b_hh=None):
  •    hsz = hidden.size(1)

  •    gi = linear(input, w_ih, b_ih)

  •    gh = linear(hidden, w_hh, b_hh)

  •    # FIXME: chunk

  •    resetgate = sigmoid(gi[:,0_hsz:1_hsz] + gh[:,0_hsz:1_hsz])

  •    inputgate = sigmoid(gi[:,1_hsz:2_hsz] + gh[:,1_hsz:2_hsz])

Ok, I see. how about add + chunk + sigmoid/tanh then? This uses less
functions as well

—

body_text:
That doesn't work for newgate.
On Mon, Oct 17, 2016 at 4:15 PM, Adam Paszke notifications@github.com
wrote:

@apaszke commented on this pull request.
In torch/nn/functions/rnn.py #129
:



   forgetgate = sigmoid(gates[:,1_hsz:2_hsz])



   cellgate   = tanh(   gates[:,2_hsz:3_hsz])



   outgate    = sigmoid(gates[:,3_hsz:4_hsz])



   cy = (forgetgate \* cx) + (ingate \* cellgate)



   hy = outgate \* tanh(cy)






   return hy, cy




+def GRUCell(input, hidden, w_ih, w_hh, b_ih=None, b_hh=None):

   hsz = hidden.size(1)



   gi = linear(input, w_ih, b_ih)



   gh = linear(hidden, w_hh, b_hh)



   # FIXME: chunk






   resetgate = sigmoid(gi[:,0_hsz:1_hsz] + gh[:,0_hsz:1_hsz])



   inputgate = sigmoid(gi[:,1_hsz:2_hsz] + gh[:,1_hsz:2_hsz])




Ok, I see. how about add + chunk + sigmoid/tanh then? This uses less
functions as well
—

.
body:
That doesn't work for newgate.

On Mon, Oct 17, 2016 at 4:15 PM, Adam Paszke notifications@github.com
wrote:

> ## _@apaszke_ commented on this pull request.
> 
> In torch/nn/functions/rnn.py https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/129
> :
> 
> > -        forgetgate = sigmoid(gates[:,1_hsz:2_hsz])
> > -        cellgate   = tanh(   gates[:,2_hsz:3_hsz])
> > -        outgate    = sigmoid(gates[:,3_hsz:4_hsz])
> > -        cy = (forgetgate \* cx) + (ingate \* cellgate)
> > -        hy = outgate \* tanh(cy)
> >   +
> > -        return hy, cy
> >   +
> >   +def GRUCell(input, hidden, w_ih, w_hh, b_ih=None, b_hh=None):
> > -        hsz = hidden.size(1)
> > -        gi = linear(input, w_ih, b_ih)
> > -        gh = linear(hidden, w_hh, b_hh)
> > -        # FIXME: chunk
> >   +
> > -        resetgate = sigmoid(gi[:,0_hsz:1_hsz] + gh[:,0_hsz:1_hsz])
> > -        inputgate = sigmoid(gi[:,1_hsz:2_hsz] + gh[:,1_hsz:2_hsz])
> 
> Ok, I see. how about add + chunk + sigmoid/tanh then? This uses less
> functions as well
> 
> —
